content.question: The first derivative of the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x equals, open parenthesis, 3 minus x squared, close parenthesis, times the cosine of x, plus 2 x times the sine of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="2.4ex" width="0.0em"></mspace><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></math>. How many points of inflection does the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have on the interval <math alttext="negative 2 less than x, less than 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo><</mo><mi>x</mi><mo><</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> ?

topic.text: 5.6: Determining Concavity of Functions over Their Domains
